This spell produces small-scale visual illusions in close proximity to the caster. Examples include flowers appearing in the palm of the caster's hand, fireworks exploding from the top of the head, or small particles of light surrounding the entire body. These illusions are obviously not real objects, and cannot provide illumination, distraction, or other significant effects. Illusions created by this spell are visual only.

This spell leaves the caster's signature on the target, which can be a solid wall or floor. The signature will continue to glow faintly and will be visible to all. Characters who have mastered the Sorcerer or Conjurer classes will recognize that this spell created the signature. The signature is limited to the name of the wizard and a title whose uniqueness and legitimacy are guaranteed by Adventure Rank.

For the effect's duration, as long as the character aims a ranged weapon or spell at the target (or all sections in the case of multiple sections), their attacks will not cause a stray shot. This effect is similar to having mastered [Targeting].
A character who steps into the area of effect will feel an unpleasant atmosphere. There is no further effect.
Increases both Fortitude and Willpower by +2 by casting a combination of [Vitality] (2nd level Truespeech spell) and [Counter Magic] (2nd level Spiritualism spell) on the target.

Any vocalizations made by the caster during the duration of the spell will be heard from the target location, not the actual position of the caster. The effect does not apply to sounds other than voice.

Creates and deploys a golem. This spell consumes the same amount of MP and materials as [Create Golem] (3rd level Spiritualism spell), except for the duration.

When an undead is created with this spell, it must meet the class level restrictions equivalent to those of [Create Golem] in both Sorcerer and Conjurer. For example, a character with Sorcerer 3/Conjurer 5 can only create a golem up to level 3 with this spell.

The golem created with this spell is limited to "Obey Command."

Creates and controls an undead. This spell consumes the same amount of MP and materials as [Create Undead] (3rd level Spiritualism spell), except for the duration.

When an undead is created with this spell, it must meet the class level restrictions equivalent to those of [Create Undead] in both Sorcerer and Conjurer. For example, a character with Sorcerer 3/Conjurer 5 can only create Undead up to level 3 with this spell.

The Undead created with this spell is limited to "Obey Command."
Remotely manipulate a lock or key with [Lock] (1st level Truespeech spell) or [Unlock] (3rd level Truespeech spell).

The caster creates a softball-sized eye that floats in the air. This eyeball can be moved at will by the caster at a speed of 30 meters per 10 seconds (1 round).

The caster can see the scene through the eyeball as if they were seeing it themselves. However, while the spell is in effect, the caster's normal vision does not work.

The eyeball is automatically destroyed if it is attacked. At this time, the spell also ends.

When a character enters the area of influence of the illusion, the temperature envisioned by the caster is sensed. The temperature can be set to anything from below freezing to the high temperature of a flame, but it cannot cause damage.

This spell can be combined with the magical illusion of [Illusion] (8th-level Spiritualism spell) and [Tactile Illusion] (9th level Deep Magic).

The caster gains the ability to fly at will, with their movement speed being the same as on the ground, and allowing all methods of movement (Limited, Normal, and Full).

Dispels all Psychic-type spells and abilities on the target. The success value must be compared for each effect to be canceled.

Caster receives a holy premonition to find a monster's weak points.

This spell can be cast during the Combat Preparation phase before combat begins. The caster gains a +2 bonus to their Monster Knowledge check immediately following the check. spells.description:
Redirects damage from the target to the caster. If the target suffers HP damage, 5 points of the applied damage is allocated as fixed damage to the caster's HP. If the originally applied damage is 5 or fewer points, all of it is given to the caster as fixed damage, and the target does not suffer any damage. This effect is automatically triggered for each hit in which the target suffers more than 1 point of applied damage, and the spell ends after that one hit.

This spell cannot be applied simultaneously to more than one target from the same caster. When a new target is targeted, the previous target will automatically cancel. It is also impossible to increase the number of targets using [Metamagic/Targets].

This spell allows the caster to analyze the situation and turn the tides of war to their advantage.

Target receives +1 to both Monster Knowledge and Initiative checks for the duration of the spell.

Redirects water currents received throughout the body and speeds up reflexes while underwater.

The target gains a +1 bonus to Evasion checks when underwater.

The caster is able to feed on the results of eliminating their enemies.

If the caster makes an Accuracy check against an enemy character with a Melee Attack or Ranged Attack and succeeds, they can add a +2 bonus to the Success Value of their Evasion check for the duration of the effect.

This effect can only be used once, but the caster can select which Evasion check to apply it to.

This spell enhances a character's movement for a short period of time by summoning a wind to push their feet.

The target's Normal Move is increased by 5 meters (Full Move +15m), but Limited Move is unaffected. This effect does not apply in Simplified Combat.

Note that the movement increase caused by this spell only affects ground-based movement.

Gives the target the power of Aurmata's leg armor.

The target is immune to poor footing for the duration of the spell. Also, if the target attacks with Kick or a similar leg- or foot-based weapon, damage is increased by +2.

A sleeping, stunned or unconscious character wakes up. If their HP is below 0, it is set to 1. If sleep is a spell or unique skill effect, then the caster needs to make a contested roll against the success value of the effect.

The affected character can take action immediately. Prone characters wake up still prone.

Gain is achieved by distracting the target or temporarily diluting the target's interest in money.

Target will not notice an error of a fractional amount less than 5% (1/20) of the total amount when conducting money transactions such as trading for the duration of this spell.

Exceptionally, this spell does not require vocalization to be cast. Also, if the target fails to resist this spell, it is unaware that this spell has been cast.

This spell removes stains from clothes and provides resistance to new stains while the clothes are worn on the body.

The target can be a piece of cloth or a garment. A single piece of fabric can be up to 5 square meters in size (e.g., a bed sheet for one adult), and a piece of clothing is sufficient to be worn by one character without difficulty.

The target is cleaned of dirt, and any tears are repaired to make it perfect. Additionally, for one day, wearing this enchanted cloth or clothing or having it directly touch the skin provides a +1 bonus to Fortitude and Willpower checks against Poison and Disease effects.

If the target is performing a check which takes more than 1 minute (6 rounds), it will be canceled.

Also, if the target has learned the combat feat [Targeting] or has a similar ability, the caster can make it lose its effect. In this case, the combat feat or ability on which it is based also loses its effect.

At the time of casting this spell, write down its success value.

At the beginning of the target's turn, it must make a Willpower save against written success value. If it fails, increase the number of failures starting from 0. When the number of failures reaches 6, the target's current HP value becomes 0 at the end of its turn.

On a successful save, the spell ends.
Imparts the ability to resist abilities used by Daemons. The target gains a +2 bonus to any Fortitude or Willpower checks against unique skills used by Daemons.

Heals Power 10 + Magic Power damage. This spell does not affect Constructs or Magitech. If the target is undead, this spell deals Power 10 + Magic Power damage instead.

If the caster doesn't know their god, the caster also learns the god's domain, symbol, and the names of his granted Specialized Divine spells. If the target doesn't have a Priest class, then the caster will know that target is not a Priest.

A target of this spell knows the spell has been used on him, even on a failed save. If the caster was visible when casting, the target would recognize the caster as the one who cast the spell.

This spell targets a single bundle of gamel coins containing 1,000 gamels or less.

The spell correctly identifies the number of legal gamel coins within the target coinage, whether gold or silver. It can also determine the authenticity of the coins, including the mixing ratio of metals, differences in minting techniques and designs, and more.

When the caster performs this spell on a certain amount of gamel coins, they will know how many of them are genuine gamel coins. It is also possible to distinguish between real and fake coins.

With more skillful handling of their fingertips, the caster can create more exquisite objects.

For the spell's duration, the user gains a +2 bonus to checks (such as Set Trap) that create or manipulate an object, or any checks with Dexterity at a Standard Value.

The caster's Stratagems will reach farther and more accurately.

For the duration of the spell, if the caster uses a Strategem of the Tactician class, the Adventurer Rank is assumed to be one level higher for the range determination. This effect does not change the caster's actual Adventurer Rank.

Spell temporarily gives the caster the vitality of the great earth.

As long as the caster is in a natural environment (see CR I, p. 101) during the duration of the effect, their maximum HP value is increased by 3 points. The current HP value is also increased (recovered) by 3 points.

If the caster leaves a natural environment during the duration of the effect, the spell is immediately canceled. Once the spell ends, if the caster's current HP value is greater than their normal maximum, the current HP value is reduced to the maximum HP value.

Helps smooth movement of wheeled vehicles, Magitechs, etc.

If the target's movement method is Wheels, the distance the target can move with Limited Move increases by 2m during the spell duration, or up to the target's Normal Move, whichever is lower.

Casters can intuitively understand and place themselves in shadows and blind spots. The caster gains a +2 bonus to Hide checks.

Also, when the caster makes an Evasion check during combat, they gain a +2 bonus to the Evasion check if there is a third character present (other than the caster and the character attempting the Accuracy check).

A bright flame emerges near the target, illuminating them and a 5m radius around them. In Simplified Combat, only the area where the target is located will be illuminated. This bright light eliminates the penalty for poor visibility and gives the target a -2 penalty to their Evasion.

A shooting star in the sky indicates the exact distance and direction to the nearest temple of Harula from the caster's current location.

Creates a golden sphere of light which removes penalties due to darkness within all areas (20m radius). This spell can be placed on an object which can be carried and moved.

The target can set traps more skillfully.

If the target performs a Set Trap check during the spell's duration, it gains a +4 bonus.

Raise a savage cry, uplifting allies and frightening foes.

All Barbarous within the area of effect deal an extra +2 physical damage with melee and ranged attacks.

This spell only works if the target can hear the caster's shout.

The target will more precisely monitor the weather around it.

If the target performs a Meteorology check within the spell's duration, it gains a +4 bonus.

Within the area of effect, any penalty due to temperature or wind, including hot and cold, is reduced by 1 point. Within the area, characters can be comfortable indoors or outdoors without need of special clothing.

In addition, the rate of plant growth is doubled in the range.

Sight will be restored if the target has been blinded by a spell or unique skills. This requires a contested check.

This spell cannot restore sight due to physical defects or if the target is inherently blind.
Dispels a Poison-type spell or effect on the target. This requires a contested check. This spell does not heal any Poison-type damage that has already been dealt.

Summons a lightning cloud overhead which strikes someone within range with lightning.

For the duration of the spell, the caster knows and can apply Weak Points against the target, regardless of the Monster Knowledge check. The combat feat [Weakness Exploit] will still double the damage dealt.

This spell doesn't work on targets without weak points.
Any [Sacred Shield] or [Sacred Weapon] spells cast by the caster for the duration of this spell will also affect Daemons.

This spell gives the target protection against impurity.

This spell creates a field blessed by the caster's deity and inhibits the intervention of other deities.

Targets will no longer be able to cast Specialized Divine Magic of a deity different from the caster for the duration of the spell.

A mana-woven thorn vine extends from the earth and tangles around the target to weaken it.

This spell targets traps that are already in place. The target on which this spell is used cannot be disarmed by a normal Disable Device check. However, if this spell is canceled by some effect (Success Value must be compared), the trap can be disarmed normally.
The target loses hearing and is unable to hear any sound. Follow the rules for deafness (see CR II, p. 71).
If the target is underwater, it is treated as having acquired the combat feat [Block] (CR1 p. 222).

Caster gains satisfaction from the quantity and value of the food they eat.

Wears down the target with multiple troubles.

The target receives a -1 penalty for each Evasive or Willpower check made in response to a hostile action made with a Major Action. This effect is cumulative up to -4 for each effect check individually but disappears when the target's turn comes. If the target performs an Evasion check or a Willpower check within the time limit, the effect of the spell remains. The penalty is applied and accumulated again each time the target performs an Evasion check or a Willpower check.

The caster can determine the monetary value of the target. The caster can determine its base price if the item has been published in rulebooks, supplements, or other sources.

The caster can obtain an approximate average value for items whose market price fluctuates significantly depending on factors such as time of year and availability.

If the target is a fake or has some other impediment to its value, and this is known by the caster, the caster can determine the fair price by subtracting (or adding) the impediment value.

If an object is damaged or has an extremely high added or scarcity value, this spell can only show its value as "unknown."

Note that this spell does not work on living creatures or characters.

Extinguishes fear and drives all affected into a blind fury.

All those affected by this spell will fight to the death as long as they detect any hostile characters.

While affected by [Frenzy], a character cannot be affected by any Psychic-type effects, and they increase all damage dealt (physical or magical) by 2 points.

The moving target blends in with the flowing wind and surrounding structures, making them difficult to perceive.

The target is unnoticeable to surrounding characters while moving with Normal Move, unless it makes a conspicuous action or utterance. Additionally, the target gains +2 to Hide checks during the spell's duration.

The spell immediately ends if the target performs any remarkable action. This includes any Major Action or Minor Action other than movement, or if the target vocalizes or makes a loud motion.

If another character is on guard or in a situation where the target is clearly not expected to be there, compare the target's Hide check with the alert character's Danger Sense check. If the target is noticed, the effect of this spell is immediately canceled.

This spell magically decorates the target item to make it appear of high value.

It makes the base price of the item appear to be twice its original price, effectively doubling the price at the time of sale (note that the original base price remains the same.)

To detect this spell, compare the Success Value of the spell with the Success Value of the character's Appraise check. If the character suspects that this spell was cast, they may substitute an Appraise check for a Detect check.

The target can choose whether to use this effect after being attacked and determining the applied damage. Once the effect is applied, the spell is canceled.

This effect even works if the target's HP falls to 0 or below due to damage, but the Death Check must still be performed before the target recovers from this effect. If the check succeeds, the target will be healed but will remain unconscious.

This effect cannot be applied to fixed damage.

For the spell's duration, the caster can transfer their thoughts to the target's mind using a Minor Action. The caster is limited to sending what they could say in ten seconds or a general impression of their intentions. If verbal communication is chosen, the target must be able to understand the words. The communication is one-way, from the caster to the target only. The caster cannot determine whether their intention or words were properly conveyed to the target or not.

The caster transforms into a pigeon, losing all original abilities and gaining the ability to fly. The movement speed of the pigeon form is 15 (Flying).

During the transformation, only checks based on Vitality, Intelligence, and Spirit can be performed using their original values. HP and MP remain the same as their original values.

While in pigeon form, no classes can be used, and the caster is only able to make squeaking sounds. All clothing, accessories, and possessions, except for minimal clothing and the caster's holy symbol, are dropped at the time of casting. (This clothing and symbol transform as part of the pigeon's form, and are restored when the spell ends.)

A beam of light bursts forth, dealing Power 10 + Magic Power magical damage. Undead creatures take additional +3 damage only on failed resistance.

Furthermore, the target's nonmetallic armor becomes immune to any effects that could reduce its Defense, such as corrosion, for the duration of the spell. The GM has the final say on which effects are affected by this spell.

When the target makes a melee attack, the weapon used is treated as a Curse-type magic weapon that deals physical damage. If the target deals physical damage to another character with this weapon during the effect's duration, the target can regain HP equal to the amount of damage dealt.

Caster sees through the eyes of a deity, detecting the enemy's unknown vulnerabilities.

If the target fails to resist, the critical threshold of any attack that hits it is reduced by 1 (criticals become more likely). This effect cannot reduce the critical threshold below 8.
Dispels all Poison- and Disease-type spells and effects on the target. This requires a contested check.

Heals Power 30 + Magic Power damage. This spell does not affect Constructs or Magitech. If the target is Undead, this spell deals Power 30 + Magic Power damage instead.

The target gains as much MP as the extra points spent in casting. For example, if 10 MP were used to cast the spell, the target would gain 9 MP.

If the caster uses the combat feat [Metamagic/Targets] to increase the number of targets, they will restore the same amount of MP to all of them. The maximum number of MP that can be transferred with this spell is 20 (for a total MP cost of 21).

The Combat Feat [MP Save/Priest] or similar combat feats cannot be used to reduce the cost of this spell.

The target receives a +6 bonus to their Dexterity, Agility, Strength, or Vitality score, resulting in a +1 bonus to their modifier. This increase can raise base stats and maximum HP. For fixed-value characters and mounts, Bless can increase Accuracy by +1 for Dexterity, Evasion and Movement Speed for Agility, and Fortitude and HP for Vitality. The GM decides if this affects any unique skills.

The caster may use Bless on the same target again to raise a different score, but not the same one. If the caster uses the Combat Feat [Metamagic/Targets] with this spell, it can be cast on multiple targets simultaneously. In this case, the ability score to be increased must be the same for all targets.

The targets fall into a healing slumber. This magical sleep is equivalent to 6 hours of normal sleep. If the target is awakened during the spell's duration, there is no restoration from sleep. The same target can receive the effects of this spell a maximum of twice per day.

Dispels one Curse-type negative effect on the target.

If the effect is the result of an item, the curse ceases to take effect for 1 minute (6 rounds) immediately after the spell is cast. If the target does not remove the cursed item during this time, or if they remove it and then re-equip it, the curse effect will reemerge.

Items are handed over so quickly that no one notices.

One item of the caster's choosing which the caster is holding or carrying as baggage is immediately passed to the target. The item passed is processed as follows.

If the item cannot be held or equipped, or does not need to be equipped immediately: The item will be received as baggage.

Weapons, shields, and items defined as "Stance: 1H/2H": If the target has sufficient free hands, it can be held and equipped immediately.

Accessories: If this spell is cast with a Major Action, the target can immediately equip the accessory in its appropriate section, if available.

Clothing and armor: The caster cannot pass on clothing or armor that are currently equipped or worn with this spell.

While affected by this spell, the caster increases their Accuracy, Fortitude, and Willpower by 3 points and deals an extra +6 physical damage. However, they also receive a -3 penalty to their Evasion and cannot cast any other spells.

This spell predicts which targets will be affected by a random selection of targets. When cast, one character is randomly determined from all the characters (sections) within range, including the caster, who cannot exclude themselves.

Once if an effect that randomly determines a target occurs, this spell makes the person affected by the spell as the target, regardless of the dice roll.

The caster may cancel the [Presage Disaster] spell (MP is still consumed) if the target of this magical effect is undesirable.

This spell can only be used once per round, and its effect is lost once it is exerted.

Effects that randomly determine the target include the [Fall Lightning] spell, Aspects of the Geomancer class, and shots fired into a skirmish by someone without [Targeting].

Target will be able to move through the air without moving their feet.

The target's Normal Move will be either their original speed or 10, whichever is lower. It will not be possible to move except by the effect of this spell (e.g., using one's legs or other similar modes of movement).

There are no restrictions on aerial movement.

This spell's effect does not apply in Simplified Combat.

Caster offers a battle song to the gods and receives their blessings.

If a character within the area of effect makes a melee or ranged attack, the character receives a +2 bonus to its Accuracy check, and all physical and magical damage dealt is increased by +2 points. However, the caster can arbitrarily decide whether or not to give this effect at the beginning of each affected character's turn.

This spell lasts as long as the caster continues to sing. The caster cannot take a Major Action on their turn as long as they are still singing.

This spell does not interfere with the effects of Spellsongs. Conversely, it is not inhibited by Spellsongs. The caster's voice does not need to be heard by the target.

This spell destroys walls up to 50cm thick, regardless of material. The height and width destroyed are 3m and 10m, respectively.

Magically erected walls (see Magus Arts, p. 76) are also removed without comparing Success Values.

This spell cannot destroy characters or inflict damage on them.

The caster's body is covered with fire (which is harmless to the caster).

Whenever the caster receives one or more points of physical or magical damage from a melee attack, the attacker immediately takes 5 Fire magic damage.
Returns a petrified target to its former state. Alternatively, it completely removes petrifaction. The effect will not work on natural stones or fossils.

Only the worthy will be blessed. Others will die.

If the target is an allied character, their maximum value of HP is increased by 5 points during the duration of the effect, and 5 points are recovered at the same time.

If the target is an enemy character, they are dealt 5 points of magic damage.

If an allied character under the effect of this spell changes into an enemy character at any point within the duration of the spell, the effect of the maximum HP increase is immediately lost, and the character immediately suffers 5 points of fixed damage afterwards.

spells.divinity: Miritsa, Goddess of Love and Vengeance
spells.description:
The caster learns all of the problems, sufferings, or difficulties the target is currently facing, along with the circumstances that created the challenges.

If the target is not directly aware of any difficulty it is facing, this spell will not reveal its contents.

Targets are distracted by the aroma of a sumptuous meal.

The targets receive a -2 penalty to all skill checks.

Instantly clears any bad weather, resulting in a clear sky no matter how bad the weather conditions were previously. There will be no rain, snow, or strong winds for the spell's duration. Clouds above the area of effect will disappear. Blue or starry skies can be seen, and the sun and moon may also appear depending on the time of day.
A force field of light surrounds and protects the target, reducing physical and magical damage against the target by 5 points per attack.

This spell attempts to convince the target that the caster is a trustworthy counterparty.

The target will treat the caster as if they were a long-time, trusted business partner. They will never question the caster's offers of deals, profits, or business. Additionally, the target may reveal secrets of other business partners, share movements of goods, and make promises that a businessman would only make to a trusted partner. They will not question the drafting of contracts.

Note that this spell only affects commercial transactions and has no effect on treaties and agreements in other areas.

The spell creates intermittent noise and flickering light in the area, which can be distracting.

Characters in the area receive a -2 penalty to their Success Value when performing a Search check, Disable Device check, or Spot Trap check.

Anyone entering the area will notice that this spell has been cast.

This spell ensures that trading involving the caster is conducted fairly. If the caster performs a monetary transaction while the spell is in effect, they will immediately detect if the other party is attempting a fraudulent transaction, regardless of whether the target is aware of it or not.

Additionally, any attempt to steal or take something from the caster will be immediately exposed.

For the duration of the spell, the caster's own attempts to make an illegal transaction (whether they are aware of it or not) will also be exposed to the other party if the caster is visible to them.

While in a natural environment (see CR I, p. 101), the caster blends into the terrain, becoming less visible.

For as long as the caster remains in a natural environment, all Accuracy checks and Spellcasting checks performed with or including the caster as a target will incur a penalty of -1 to the success value. This effect occurs even for Area: Line effects. If the caster is explicitly excluded from the target by [Magic Control], this effect will not occur.

Additionally, if the caster makes a Hide check in a natural environment, they gain a +4 bonus.

When the caster performs a skill check included in the Observation or Knowledge check packages (see CR I, p. 114), the result of the check can be an automatic success (assuming double 6s are rolled) without rolling any dice.

This effect disappears after one use. This spell can only be cast once per day.

The caster knows the position of all creatures in the spell's range, their maximum HP, and their current HP value. The creatures that can be sensed must be at least large enough to be seen by the human eye.

Gives the target the power of Aurmata's mechanical wings.

The target can fly for the duration of the spell, with a Normal Move of 30.

The target cannot take any Major Action while flying under the effect of this spell.

This spell sends words of encouragement to the target and removes any negative effects. It can remove any one effect of the Psychic type that the target is experiencing without requiring a Success Value comparison.

This spell envelops the target in a holy robe made of mana, providing protection.

The target's Defense increases by 5 points, and any applied magic damage is reduced by 5 points.

While under the spell's effects, the target cannot move or perform Major or Minor Actions.

Subjects who fail to resist become non-hostile and will no longer actively participate in combat. If possible, they will also attempt to stop others on their side from engaging in combat, and will avoid starting new hostilities for the duration of the spell.

This effect ends if another character is overly hostile toward the target, or the target is attacked.

Assigns a mission to the target. The exact details of the mission are left up to the caster, but the parameters (success, failure, any restrictions, etc.) must be clearly defined.

If the target consciously delays going on the quest or actively tries to fail, they will receive 1 fixed point of damage per round.

Once the quest has been fulfilled, this effect ends.

The target assumes that a character specified by the caster is an enemy and viciously attacks them. Only one character can be specified. The target will use its own turn to attack the specified character with whatever weapon (e.g., Claws or Bite for a monster) it is currently equipped with. In general, this attack should be picked by GM as the most efficient attack without penalties to the target, with unique skills to increase its effectiveness if applicable. However, if the equipped weapon is a ranged weapon, the target must be willing to spend ammunition. [Solid Bullet] will be used if the weapon is a gun.

This spell has no effect if the targeted character cannot attack.

Destroys the caster's holy symbol to recover HP.

Restores 30 HP to characters in the target area. This spell does not affect Undead, Magitech, or Constructs.

The holy symbol spent for this spell cannot be repaired, and the caster cannot use Divine Magic for 1d days afterward, even if a new holy symbol is acquired.

Summons an Aetherbeast.

Immediately after being summoned, the monster acts according to "Obey Command" (see Magus Arts, p. 87). However, it acts on its own will and judgment if no instructions are given.

The immortal goddess's favor manifests over the target's head, blocking sunlight.

The target will no longer suffer any adverse effects caused by sunlight.

When this spell is cast, the caster designates a place that the caster has actually visited as the destination. That place doesn't need to be visible at the time of casting. Once the spell has been cast, the entire non-blocked path to the destination will appear luminous to the caster for the duration of the spell.

Whatever the complexity of the path, if it eventually leads to the destination, the path will glow. It is useful for choosing a fork in the road and determining which way to go on a single path.

A trail or pathway is also treated as a path, but if there is a place (including a closed door, etc.) where the caster's body cannot pass, the path or passage is considered to be cut off there (i.e., the shining will not lead past there).

This spell will have no affect unless the caster is standing on an obvious path or passageway.

Once every 10 seconds (1 round), the caster deals 3 points of fixed damage to all enemy characters within the area of effect. If the target targets a character other than themselves, the target must be chosen at random from among all possible characters that could be the target of the action (e.g., all characters in a skirmish if it is a melee attack).

Paro allows for conversations with remote locations through Paro's shrines and temples.

Both characters can hear and talk to each other through the shrines or temples. Both characters should cast this spell in a Paro shrine or temple to create a connection.

During the conversation, the target's body must be touching some part of the targeted shrine or temple (including the floor). When multiple characters touch the same shrine or temple, those people can talk to each other simultaneously. The effect of the spell lasts until it is deactivated, and any two people touching a shrine or temple at a distance can talk to each other at any time.

Soft moonlight envelops the area, reducing damage.

Within the effect range, when a character calculates physical damage or magic damage using the Power Table or when a character with a fixed value determines damage, the roll of 2d is fixed to 3. This effect cannot be reversed by [Sword's Grace/Change Fate]. The effect of rerolling the dice is formally effective but practically meaningless since the new roll is also fixed at 3.

Effects that modify damage rolls, such as [Lethal Strike], are still effective.

Once the caster has created a track, it will not be lost even if the caster backtracks, and a new branch will occur if the caster steps out in a different direction.

In combat, using this light path does not allow the caster to avoid movement blocking or break away from a skirmish. After the spell duration expires, the line of light disappears.

Grants the target a fraction of Lumiere's grace.

Choose one of the following: [Sword's Grace/Change Fate], [Sword's Grace/Gentle Water], [Sword's Grace/Body Of Flame], or [Sword's Grace/Wings Of The Wind]. The target becomes jealous of every character around them, especially family, partners, and close friends, and will explicitly and vociferously express this newfound feeling.

During the effect time, the target cannot perform any actions to assist or support other characters (regardless of its own gain or loss, advantage or disadvantage).

This spell imbues an ordinary coin with exceptional luck which can save the caster from unexpected danger. It might only be a coin which brings good fortune, or a coin that the caster has in their pocket that deflects a fatal blow.

If the caster performs a Notice check, Danger Sense check, Spot Trap check, or Death Check within the spell's duration, they gain a +4 bonus modifier.

If the caster does not have any money, this spell will not work. If the spell's effect is invoked, the caster's money is reduced by 1 gamel.

The caster entrusts the target with its thoughts.

The target will have its number of Major Actions increased by one on the first turn within the spell’s duration after this spell is cast. This effect is automatically lost once the action is taken.
Removes all poisons and disease effects from the target. No comparison of success values is necessary. This spell cannot heal Poison- or Disease-type damage that has already been applied.

This spell brands willing targets with the same holy symbol of the deity the caster follows. The target can also gain their first level as a Priest by paying 1,000 Experience at this time. This spell takes one hour to cast.

The caster creates a simple trap on their body.

If the caster receives physical or magical damage during the spell's duration and their HP is reduced by more than 10 points, the target that dealt damage receives fixed damage equal to the caster's Priest class level with "Resistance: Can't." The target must be visible to the caster, but distance is not a factor.

Once this effect is used, it is lost.

A holy bandage appears and wraps around the target's wound, instantly healing it.

This bandage can remove any one effect of the Poison, Disease or Curse type that the target is experiencing without requiring a Success Value comparison.

This spell has no effect unless the target is a daemon.

A chain of pure mana entangles the target. The target will be unable to move by any special means, spells, abilities, or effects.

The target of this spell simultaneously experiences pleasure when obeying the caster and fear when disobeying.

Wide-range effects that include the caster are also subject to bonus and penalty modifications.

When this spell is cast, 1 HP is consumed simultaneously as MP. If the spell is cast on characters in multiple sections or with [Metamagic/**], the HP consumption is doubled.
